str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I am sober), I am calm (vigilant), circumspect. Of uncertain affinity: to abstain from wine, i.e. be discreet.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To suffer evil, endure affliction. From the same as kakopatheia; to undergo hardship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
An evangelist, a missionary, bearer of good tidings. From euaggelizo; a preacher of the gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pleres and phoreo; to carry out fully, i.e. Completely assure, entirely accomplish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
